steps.title: Collect your newspapers.
steps.content: Collect your newspapers. A large pile from a week or two's reading should be a good start.

steps.title: Divide the newspapers up into sections.
steps.content: Divide the newspapers up into sections. Each section should be folded to the size of half a page.

steps.title: Fill a tub of water.
steps.content: Fill a tub of water. Add a tablespoon of detergent to the water and mix gently. [1] X Research source

steps.title: [ Soak each folded section in the tub of water.
steps.content: [ Soak each folded section in the tub of water.

steps.title: Remove the sections carefully and lay down on a clean surface.
steps.content: Remove the sections carefully and lay down on a clean surface.

steps.title: Roll each section individually on the rod and squeeze out any excess water.
steps.content: Roll each section individually on the rod and squeeze out any excess water. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Slide each roll off the rod.
steps.content: Slide each roll off the rod. Stand each roll on one end and leave to dry thoroughly.

steps.title: Store.
steps.content: Store. Once thoroughly dry, the newspaper logs are ready for use. They should be stored in a dry, well-ventilated area.

steps.title: Roll 12 newspapers up tightly into a log shape.
steps.content: Roll 12 newspapers up tightly into a log shape.

steps.title: Tie each end of the log with string.
steps.content: Tie each end of the log with string. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Soak the log in water for two to three days.
steps.content: Soak the log in water for two to three days.

steps.title: Leave to drain for two to three days.
steps.content: Leave to drain for two to three days.

steps.title: Use on a fire that is burning well.
steps.content: Use on a fire that is burning well. These logs will still be damp and this helps them to burn more slowly, giving off a steady heat.

steps.title: Obtain a newspaper brick maker.
steps.content: Obtain a newspaper brick maker. You will need a newspaper brick maker for this or create your own press with some wood. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Collect old newspaper from friends and neighbors.
steps.content: Collect old newspaper from friends and neighbors.

steps.title: Get a bucket of water.
steps.content: Get a bucket of water.

steps.title: Shred up the newspaper.
steps.content: Shred up the newspaper. Place into the bucket. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Let the newspaper soak for 10 minutes.
steps.content: Let the newspaper soak for 10 minutes.

steps.title: Place in the newspaper brick maker or the press.
steps.content: Place in the newspaper brick maker or the press. Compact down the newspaper squeezing out all of the water. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Take the log out.
steps.content: Take the log out. Let it dry on a wooden board.

steps.title: When dry, put it on the fire and watch it burn.
steps.content: When dry, put it on the fire and watch it burn. The logs usually burn for 45 minutes.
